body:
I would like to provide a generic `operating_system` value in my compiler spec or possibly leave it blank and allow spack to auto-detect it.

### Rationale

https://github.com/LLNL/serac/blob/917eb8f05b99496e29772e251dc5b4ae8c88dd92/scripts/spack/configs/darwin/compilers.yaml#L8

This requires the user to alter this line to `bigsur`, `catalina`, etc.  I could copy and paste the same compiler spec several times but that seems unhelpful.  I am just looking to reduce the duplicate specs I provide Spack.  If there is a better way to handle this that I don't know about, I would appreciate that.

### Description

Possible solutions:

* "auto" for `operating_system`
* Leave it out completely
* List of options? `["bigsur", "catalina"]`
title: Add an "any" option to operating_systems in compiler spec
